title.value: Tri-process model of interpersonal mindfulness: theoretical framework and study protocol
title.justification: This is the exact title of the paper as provided.
title.quote: Tri-process model of interpersonal mindfulness: theoretical framework and study protocol

extractions.description: This paper presents a theoretical framework known as the tri-process model of interpersonal mindfulness and describes a study protocol aimed at validating this model. The model posits that mindfulness meditation training enhances self-awareness, self-regulation, and prosocial behaviors, which in turn improve interpersonal interactions and socioemotional support.

type.justification: The paper is focused on presenting a new theoretical model and study protocol rather than reporting empirical findings.
type.quote: The aim of this paper is to present a tri-process theoretical model of interpersonal mindfulness and a study protocol to validate the proposed model.

name.justification: The paper is related to how mindfulness affects interpersonal relationships, a topic commonly explored in Personality and Social Psychology.
name.quote: This article was submitted to Personality and Social Psychology, a section of the journal Frontiers in Psychology

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on mindfulness and its effects on interpersonal relationships.
name.quote: Recent studies suggest that mindfulness training not only has positive effects on those receiving the training, but also on the quality of their interpersonal relationships.
